action.action-desc: Ms. Kaptur (for herself and Mr. Joyce of Ohio) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to provide technical and financial assistance to identify, conserve, restore, and interpret natural, recreational, historical, and cultural resources within the Great Lakes Watershed, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Great Lakes Gateways Network Act of 2025.

paragraph.text: The Secretary of the Interior (referred to in this section as the Secretary), in cooperation with the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency (referred to in this section as the Administrator), shall provide technical and financial assistance, in cooperation with other Federal agencies, State and local governments, nonprofit organizations, and the private sector to—

subparagraph.text: identify, conserve, restore, and interpret natural, recreational, historical, and cultural resources within the Great Lakes Watershed;
identify and use the collective resources as Great Lakes Gateways sites for enhancing public education regarding and access to the Great Lakes;
link the Great Lakes Gateways sites with trails, tour roads, scenic byways, and other connections as determined by the Secretary;
develop and establish Great Lakes Watertrails comprising water routes and connections to Great Lakes Gateways sites and other land resources within the Great Lakes Watershed; and
create a Great Lakes Gateways Network comprised of Great Lakes Gateways sites and Great Lakes Watertrails.

paragraph.text: Components of the Great Lakes Gateways Network may include—

subparagraph.text: State or Federal parks or refuges;
archaeological, cultural, historical, or recreational sites; or
other public access and interpretive sites as selected by the Secretary.

subsection.header: Great Lakes Gateways Grants Assistance Program

paragraph.text: The Secretary, in cooperation with the Administrator, shall establish a Great Lakes Gateways Grants Assistance Program to aid State and local governments, local communities, nonprofit organizations, and the private sector in conserving, restoring, and interpreting important historic, cultural, recreational, and natural resources within the Great Lakes Watershed.
The Secretary, in cooperation with the Administrator, shall develop appropriate eligibility, prioritization, and review criteria for grants under this section.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $6,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2026 through 2031.
